titles.title: Gramm-Rudman Repeal Act
A bill to repeal the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985.

action.text: Read twice and referred jointly to the Committees on Budget; Governmental Affairs pursuant to the order of August 4, 1977, with instructions that if one committee reports, the other has thirty days of continuous session to report or be discharged.

bill.summary: 1/6/1987--Introduced. Gramm-Rudman Repeal Act - Repeals the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 (Gramm-Rudman-Hollings Act), except for specified provisions concerning the restoration of funds to the social security trust funds and other Government trust funds, the budgetary treatment of social security trust funds, and a point of order against reconciliation measures providing for changes in the Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance program (title II of the Social Security Act).
